commit_message:
Fix a LOG.warning which didn't work properly

Found when checking ci logs here:

http://logs.openstack.org/41/587041/3/check/ironic-inspector-tempest-dsvm-discovery/7912a3a/logs/screen-ironic-inspector.txt.gz#_Oct_17_16_44_39_477744

It's supposed to be printing missing arguments when constructing
an http client.

The http client is supposed to be removed ?soon?, so if the fix is
not required, please let me know.

Change-Id: I2bad387afa2ede56da7164a7bc9a5ac461e78d9c
(cherry picked from commit a28ccb9ef8a55f96923ba4a3af12b73a91b2e448)

Fix QuotasNegativeTest to use non dynamic credentials

The tests with enabled force_tenant_isolation option always use dynamic
credentials. Made changes to QuotasNegativeTest to run test in the new
project.

Closes-Bug: #1789938

subject: Make port binding attempt after agent is revived
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-23 09:01:18.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/base.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_ports_rebind.py', 'neutron/objects/ports.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Make port binding attempt after agent is revived

In some cases it may happen that port is "binding_failed"
because L2 agent running on destination host was down but
this is "temporary" issue.
It is like that for example in case when using L3 HA and when
master and backup network nodes were e.g. rebooted.
L3 agent might start running before L2 agent on host in such case
and if it's new master node, router ports will have "binding_failed"
state.

When agent sends heartbeat and is getting back to live,
ML2 plugin will try to bind all ports with "binding_failed"
from this host.

Change-Id: I3bedb7c22312884cc28aa78aa0f8fbe418f97090
Closes-Bug: #1794809
(cherry picked from commit f787f12aa3441ecffef55f261c4d87dbb12ca6cf)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-07-16 07:47:34.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5aea94cce51f71d98135ef94bab7445de59fa3a5
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5aea94cce51f71d98135ef94bab7445de59fa3a5

commit_message:
Dynamically find releases for move-implemented-specs

This adds a shallow directory walk to find the available releases for
moving implemented specs, so we don't have to update the script per
release to add a release choice.

Change-Id: I80ea14f07da9361b26645d997de0fcbe4ba19afc

commit_message:
Provide a region to the K8S Fedora Atomic config

Kubernetes should initialize its Global configuration for the OpenStack
provider with the region specified in the Heat stack.
This will allow user to create Magnum Kubernetes clusters in
multiregional OpenStack installation with different public endpoint for
services.

Task: 22576
Story: 2002728
Change-Id: I66820369b889e16445cad7a48cd0f458aae1c41f
(cherry picked from commit a28e5609f991ce32255f7badcad2514ca8e66ab8)

commit_message:
Install python-virtualenv if not available

This role is failing as it's attempting to to pip
install pip in the geneal env, but pip is not available
on some platforms.
This review does the install in a venv.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-10-19 04:14:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-09-18 00:52:56.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh'], 'message': "Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml',
but I think it's ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031
Task: 26347
Story: 2003697
"}]
commit_message:
Add prometheus-monitoring namespace

When using 'prometheus_monitoring=true' in the label option,
'kube-enable-monitoring.service' in the master node has stuck in
'Wait for Grafana pod and then inject data source'.
It caused the 'prometheus-monitoring' namespace doesn't exist,
so scripts don't create pods about Prometheus and Grafana.

To fix the error, I added codes in 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/
kubernetes/fragments/enable-prometheus-monitoring.sh' to make
'prometheus-monitoring' namespace.

We could put codes in a new file like 'magnum/magnum/drivers/
k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml',
but I think it's ok.

Change-Id: I23395b41919c6f39cfcc2b4480bcd4b040cae031
Task: 26347
Story: 2003697

commit_message:
Use supplied HELM variable for dep up in Makefile

Updates the helm dep up command to use the $(HELM) variable instead of
the locally istalled helm for the host machine. This bring this line of
code in alignment with the other uses of helm in the same Makefile.

Change-Id: I91bfdceedd3bac0ac49daf5b9410c05e0e840168

commit_message:
Add ram/cpu/disk allocation ratio to Hypervisor show

Currently, the ``GET /os-hypervisors/detail`` and
``GET /os-hypervisors/{hypervisor_id}`` API does not get
ram_allocation_ratio, cpu_allocation_ratio and
disk_allocation_ratio.
The user sets the allocation ratio by using the
configuration, but they can not see through Nova API.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint: add-ratio-to-hypervisor-show

Change-Id: Iaa92f61bc21b338aa935ad272c3758ace3f99eb4

commit_message:
Fix the missing region name information for Keystone client

When using several regions, Rally's Keystone client does not use
the region endpoint specified in the context. So we added
the region name used in credentials to be able to connect
to the correct region endpoint

Change-Id: I441aee8ffb82963396d40405ea740276edc7dfe5
Co-Authored-By: rcherrueau <Ronan-Alexandre.Cherrueau@inria.fr>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-10-23 09:09:04.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/sources-branch-updater-lib.sh'], 'message': "scripts: sources-branch-updater: Make regexp for master branch stricter

The regexp does not work properly when the upstream repo has many

0fa368a7441528457b7bcb99f8a860d7987b9ba6 refs/heads/guits-update_req_master
79bd06ad28d8a078bd95923b230eb8d5b66095b2 refs/heads/master

commit_message:
scripts: sources-branch-updater: Make regexp for master branch stricter

The regexp does not work properly when the upstream repo has many
branches named 'master' such as ceph-ansible

0fa368a7441528457b7bcb99f8a860d7987b9ba6 refs/heads/guits-update_req_master
79bd06ad28d8a078bd95923b230eb8d5b66095b2 refs/heads/master

which breaks the script when bumping SHAs. As such, lets make it
stricter by simply matching /master$ instead.

Change-Id: I24526a358d7a21821f8c9789ba199863981f8d7b
(cherry picked from commit a9c72408bef1508fe26f515db02e347892ed8618)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-08 10:08:44.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-kubernetes-master.sh'], 'message': "Make master node schedulable with taints

--register-with-taints take no effect when --register-schedulable=false
configured. It's better to drop --register-schedulable and
leave --register-with-taints to make master schedulable

add --pod-infra-container-image=CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX
for kubelet on master nodes.

Change-Id: Ia2ce59841d823ba02a65224088e5af1a8c9610b1
"}]
commit_message:
Make master node schedulable with taints

--register-with-taints take no effect when --register-schedulable=false
configured. It's better to drop --register-schedulable and
leave --register-with-taints to make master schedulable

add --pod-infra-container-image=CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX
for kubelet on master nodes.

Change-Id: Ia2ce59841d823ba02a65224088e5af1a8c9610b1

subject: Switch nodepool builders to zk cluster
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 16:29:00.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml', 'nodepool/nb03.openstack.org.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch nodepool builders to zk cluster

Switch over the nodepool builders to our newer zk cluster from the old
single node zk cluster. We will stop building images that the launchers
can see before the launchers move, but this lets us preseed the new
cluster with up to date image data.

Once the images are built with records in the new zk cluster we can
switch over the zuul scheduler and the launchers to this newer cluster.

Change-Id: I95ca326095decc03cf279383fa48dbdfc56ed8c8
'}]
commit_message:
Switch nodepool builders to zk cluster

Switch over the nodepool builders to our newer zk cluster from the old
single node zk cluster. We will stop building images that the launchers
can see before the launchers move, but this lets us preseed the new
cluster with up to date image data.

Once the images are built with records in the new zk cluster we can
switch over the zuul scheduler and the launchers to this newer cluster.

Change-Id: I95ca326095decc03cf279383fa48dbdfc56ed8c8

subject: Correct check for b64 encoding
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-10-23 15:27:14.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ssl_utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_ssl_utils.py'], 'message': "Correct check for b64 encoding

The previous fix for Bug #1798066 assumed that b64 decoding a
PEM certificate would throw an exception. This is not true as
PEM certs are b64 encoded. This fix explicitly checks for the
'BEGIN CERTIFICATE' string to check if the supplied ssl_ca
value is encoded or not.

Change-Id: I4fbdb0c2f768f2641b8fb3b43a4f94f2748484c0
"}]
commit_message:
Correct check for b64 encoding

The previous fix for Bug #1798066 assumed that b64 decoding a
PEM certificate would throw an exception. This is not true as
PEM certs are b64 encoded. This fix explicitly checks for the
'BEGIN CERTIFICATE' string to check if the supplied ssl_ca
value is encoded or not.

Change-Id: I4fbdb0c2f768f2641b8fb3b43a4f94f2748484c0

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-03-29 07:36:45.000000000', 'files': ['specs/rocky/approved/resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys.rst'], 'message': 'Adds resize on shared storage without ssh keys

Resizing an instance on KVM currently requires passwordless ssh access
between all compute nodes. This is not necessarily needed for resizing
an instance where the underlying storage is shared. This spec therefore
addresses a solution to avoid having a single ssh key deployed on all
compute nodes which could be a security risk or a company policy issue.

Change-Id: Ifc95c5d1494a44eb42355556051628b2ef36fbcd
Implements: blueprint resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys
'}]
commit_message:
Adds resize on shared storage without ssh keys

Resizing an instance on KVM currently requires passwordless ssh access
between all compute nodes. This is not necessarily needed for resizing
an instance where the underlying storage is shared. This spec therefore
addresses a solution to avoid having a single ssh key deployed on all
compute nodes which could be a security risk or a company policy issue.

Change-Id: Ifc95c5d1494a44eb42355556051628b2ef36fbcd
Implements: blueprint resize-on-shared-storage-without-ssh-keys

commit_message:

commit_message:
[gate] Put nfs-provisioner in it's own namespace

Having storage (backend) components in their own namespace means we
can delete the namespaces containing the openstack without causing
system hangs which occur when storage is remove whilst in use.

Change-Id: Ie489709b08929f25cf0e626a8541620a06506b8b

In https://review.openstack.org/611582 we removed
the legacy group as it has been deprecated since
Newton, however it appears to still be used by some
downstream tests, so we add it back, but make it
only get implemented if the associated services
are enabled.

commit_message:
Set container_name as host_var in test inventory

The connection plugin no longer falls back on using the
inventory_hostname as the container_name. Set container_name as a host
var for each container in the test inventory.

In this role's case there are no containers, so I've just removed
the group_var so that the test setup is uniform with other roles
which do use containers.

Change-Id: If491e94c5d66f7e236bd344980b3d63ab22761d5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 17591, 'name': 'Steve Wilkerson', 'email': 'wilkers.steve@gmail.com', 'username': 'srwilkers'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 29106, 'name': 'kranthi kiran guttikonda', 'email': 'kranthi.guttikonda@att.com', 'username': 'kranthikirang'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-10-11 20:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['prometheus/values.yaml'], 'message': 'Prometheus kubelet.rules change

kube_node_status_ready and up metrics are obsolete to check the kubernetes
node condition. When a kubelet is down that means node itself in NotReady
state. With 1.3.1 kube-state-metrics exporter kube_node_status_condition
metric provides the status value of the kubelet (essentially node).
https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/master/Documentation
/node-metrics.md

kube_node_status_condition includes condition=Ready and status as true,
flase and unknown. When a kubelet is stopped the status will be unknown
since the kubelet itself will unable to talk to API. In other cases it
will be false. When the node is registered and available it will be set to
true.

Replaced the kube_node_status_ready with kube_node_status_condition and
changed the 1h to 1m and increased the severity to "critical". Also
modified the K8SKubeletDown definitions with 1m and critical sevrity

Implements: Bug 1797133
Closes-Bug: #1797133
Change-Id: I025adb13c9d8642a218dfda1ff30f1577fa8c826
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Kiran Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Prometheus kubelet.rules change

kube_node_status_ready and up metrics are obsolete to check the kubernetes
node condition. When a kubelet is down that means node itself in NotReady
state. With 1.3.1 kube-state-metrics exporter kube_node_status_condition
metric provides the status value of the kubelet (essentially node).
https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/master/Documentation
/node-metrics.md

kube_node_status_condition includes condition=Ready and status as true,
flase and unknown. When a kubelet is stopped the status will be unknown
since the kubelet itself will unable to talk to API. In other cases it
will be false. When the node is registered and available it will be set to
true.

Replaced the kube_node_status_ready with kube_node_status_condition and
changed the 1h to 1m and increased the severity to "critical". Also
modified the K8SKubeletDown definitions with 1m and critical sevrity

Implements: Bug 1797133
Closes-Bug: #1797133
Change-Id: I025adb13c9d8642a218dfda1ff30f1577fa8c826
Signed-off-by: Kranthi Kiran Guttikonda <kranthi.guttikonda@b-yond.com>

subject: Add mount state rescue block
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-23 15:29:47.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/systemd_mounts.yml'], 'message': 'Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Support shared/dedicated vCPUs in one instance

This feature enables instances that have vCPUs that are pinned to specific
pCPUs and vCPUs that are not pinned to specific pCPUs. We introduce
``hw:shared_vcpus`` as an additional option of ``hw:cpu-policy=dedicated``
in the flavor extra spec.

Co-Authored-By: dineshbhor <dinesh.bhor@nttdata.com>
Blueprint: mixed-cpu-policy-instance
Change-Id: I3004d19e26bc949eb84ac50c65f6b0aa8ee1150a

Install packages from PIP_PACKAGES before wheel build to be able
to limit dependencies specified in "setup_requires" of packages
listed in upper-constraints.txt, that pip has no way to control.

Change-Id: I36bd4347727b4c7f4beea2cdba6674445fbb4ca4

commit_message:
Install pip packages during requirements build

Install packages from PIP_PACKAGES before wheel build to be able
to limit dependencies specified in "setup_requires" of packages
listed in upper-constraints.txt, that pip has no way to control.
This is intended to work around https://github.com/lxc/pylxd/issues/308
or similar issues.

Change-Id: I36bd4347727b4c7f4beea2cdba6674445fbb4ca4

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-04-19 17:21:08.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Handle in-tree tempest plugins

A recent patch[1] enabled upper-constraints checking for tempest plugins.
This patch causes failures for some scenarios with in-tree tempest plugins
because pip does not allow applying constraints to local paths. The resulting
error is "installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version".

This patch handles local paths and URLs without checking upper constraints
but maintains the functionality for packages by name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/560946
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/39/541039/13/check/octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario/ \
    c801e2b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-17_22_09_54_936113

Change-Id: I445e218ff6a7d739e5f144833853726deaaa1a3a
'}]
commit_message:
Handle in-tree tempest plugins

A recent patch[1] enabled upper-constraints checking for tempest plugins.
This patch causes failures for some scenarios with in-tree tempest plugins
because pip does not allow applying constraints to local paths. The resulting
error is "installation from path or url cannot be constrained to a version".

This patch handles local paths and URLs without checking upper constraints
but maintains the functionality for packages by name.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/560946
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/39/541039/13/check/octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario/ \
    c801e2b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-17_22_09_54_936113

Change-Id: I445e218ff6a7d739e5f144833853726deaaa1a3a

subject: Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-20 08:12:29.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirement-pins.txt'], 'message': 'Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for
its dependency Cython. As Cython is not present in upper-constraints
there is nothing to stop the repo build from using the new one, and
the gnocchi venv build fails.

Change-Id: Ib85d545a8879b82be8d492809f9764fa0efb78e6
(cherry picked from commit 1fd9fdc6d8bc82422211f68a99f5b153b2446d19)
'}]
commit_message:
Set an upper pin for Cython to please gnocchi

Gnocchi depends on pycradox, which currently has an upper limit for
its dependency Cython. As Cython is not present in upper-constraints
there is nothing to stop the repo build from using the new one, and
the gnocchi venv build fails.

Change-Id: Ib85d545a8879b82be8d492809f9764fa0efb78e6
(cherry picked from commit 1fd9fdc6d8bc82422211f68a99f5b153b2446d19)

commit_message:
Make horizon DB management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: I441d5d30e06f24a1149926f9068e7e4838b3a723

subject: Fix issues with and enable Python 3 job
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-10-22 22:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml', 'strategy/tagfilter.py'], 'message': 'Fix issues with and enable Python 3 job

Python 3 disallows implicit relative imports.

When skip_tags is provided as a single string, it will need to be cast
to an array to avoid being treated as a list of characters when compared
to task.tags.

Change-Id: Ib8e7b67b9400fb983aecaae95f50bb3ec35d4c26
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with and enable Python 3 job

Python 3 disallows implicit relative imports.

When skip_tags is provided as a single string, it will need to be cast
to an array to avoid being treated as a list of characters when compared
to task.tags.

Change-Id: Ib8e7b67b9400fb983aecaae95f50bb3ec35d4c26

subject: Add support for subnet assignment when creating servers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-11-07 05:41:05.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/subnet-support-when-boot.rst'], 'message': 'Add support for subnet assignment when creating servers

When there are multiple subnets on a network, currently it
is impossible to pass a subnet parameter to the API request
and boot an instance on a specific subnet of that network.
This blueprint aims to modify the create server API to accept
``subnet_id`` as an additional parameter of ``networks`` field
and make booting on a specific subnet of a given network possible.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d1c521b2974dc57072ae0d972e33ca677d2a462
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for subnet assignment when creating servers

When there are multiple subnets on a network, currently it
is impossible to pass a subnet parameter to the API request
and boot an instance on a specific subnet of that network.
This blueprint aims to modify the create server API to accept
``subnet_id`` as an additional parameter of ``networks`` field
and make booting on a specific subnet of a given network possible.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d1c521b2974dc57072ae0d972e33ca677d2a462

subject: Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-23 12:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/discover.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_discovery.py'], 'message': 'Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic

For (unclear) historical reasons the root single version endpoint also
contains "id" and "links" fields. This makes the current workaround
for old-style endpoints take priority over the correct algorithm.
This change reorders the code, so that if "version" is present, it
always take priority over the workaround.

The unit tests are updated to be closer to real output from ironic.

Change-Id: I743b954c6c5b2f986c213acb6ec6af7e08c9f5f8
'}]
commit_message:
Make new-style single endpoint version discovery actually work for ironic

For (unclear) historical reasons the root single version endpoint also
contains "id" and "links" fields. This makes the current workaround
for old-style endpoints take priority over the correct algorithm.
This change reorders the code, so that if "version" is present, it
always take priority over the workaround.

The unit tests are updated to be closer to real output from ironic.

Change-Id: I743b954c6c5b2f986c213acb6ec6af7e08c9f5f8

commit_message:
Make glance cache management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: Ia14e867347aeadc6c55cef49f9f2ae0e6f86412f

commit_message:
Switch the charm to support py3

Some major changes:
* the charm has been rebased (from a Python perspective) to be rooted in
  the charm directory.  This is a single root.
* Imports have been changed so that the don't add lots of imports to the
  namespace of the module doing the import.
* The code that used to run at module import time has been made lazy
  such that it only has to run if the relevant functions are called.
  This includes restart_on_change parameters, the harden function and
  the parameters to the guard_map.  Appropriate changes will be
  submitted to charm-helpers.
* Several tests had to be re-written as (incorrect) mocking meant that
  text fixtures didn't actually match what the code was doing.  Thus,
  the tests were meaningless.
* This has had a net positive impact on the unit tests wrt to importing
  modules and mocking.

Change-Id: Id07d9d1caaa9b29453a63c2e49ba831071e9457f

subject: Update Ansible to 2.5.10
revisions:

mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ie05a1bbd4abd62527b373de54bf6673a5aba8e50

commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ie05a1bbd4abd62527b373de54bf6673a5aba8e50

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-10-23 11:52:04.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I663739e2be72e32101764cbccc9713f1f9ba303a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I663739e2be72e32101764cbccc9713f1f9ba303a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add framework for sahara-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of sahara-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: Idcb8d9eaf689800812cf6087e9c5937058c89ea6
Story: 2003657
Task: 26152

commit_message:
Build OpenSUSE Leap 15 by default

This includes the building of OpenSUSE Leap 15 in checks/gates.

As the build of each project requires the building of the
requirements first, added to the fact that a new distro is added
into the jobs, this extends the timeout for the base job beyond
the maximum time for requirements, so that all the projects
(excluding requirements) have more time to complete.

Change-Id: I73b055b3942a6d80b8474544a9d65df0b3005e15

subject: Fix parameters in run-tempest role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 13:57:20.000000000', 'files': ['roles/run-tempest/tasks/main.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix parameters in run-tempest role

Readme of run-tempest job declares variable `tempest_test_regex`
to be a regular expression used to select the tests. But in
order to work this variable needs to be passed to tox with
--regex keyword. Otherwise it is passed as positional parameter
leading to error: "tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments" [1]

The similar issue is with `tempest_test_blacklist`, which is declared
as a blacklist file to skip tests that are not needed, so should be
passed with --blacklist-file parameter.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/609959/2/check/tempest-full-profiler-enabled/3054075/ara-report/result/1e906e1a-aa43-42a0-b5fa-2926916dc294/

Change-Id: I0cd0e7c0cfcbd9942736b6a7cbd0929e3878b2e0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix parameters in run-tempest role

Readme of run-tempest job declares variable `tempest_test_regex`
to be a regular expression used to select the tests. But in
order to work this variable needs to be passed to tox with
--regex keyword. Otherwise it is passed as positional parameter
leading to error: "tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments" [1]

The similar issue is with `tempest_test_blacklist`, which is declared
as a blacklist file to skip tests that are not needed, so should be
passed with --blacklist-file parameter.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/59/609959/2/check/tempest-full-profiler-enabled/3054075/ara-report/result/1e906e1a-aa43-42a0-b5fa-2926916dc294/

Change-Id: I0cd0e7c0cfcbd9942736b6a7cbd0929e3878b2e0

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add mount state rescue block

The mount state could be volitile making it so the "restart-or-reload"
option fails to execute. If this happens the task will now be rescued
and the mount state will be attempted using the regular systemd
module.

Change-Id: I86fc03ad7c72fa4cfdfc598f552f936dda653926
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-03 04:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I225b740cd85207e2785ab60ba7e626a773617b0c
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I225b740cd85207e2785ab60ba7e626a773617b0c

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: Ifd7cb0d548431095294ad40c99703604f0022888
Closes-Bug: #1798594

subject: Update Ansible to 2.5.10
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 14:17:59.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': 'Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ic8a4ab15663b034b2daa82ce274c31194357e745
'}]
commit_message:
Update Ansible to 2.5.10

With the 2.5.10 release of Ansible, the mysql modules no
longer rely on MySQLdb and therefore no longer need the
mysql-python library - it all uses pymysql instead which
is pure python and python3 capable.

Change-Id: Ic8a4ab15663b034b2daa82ce274c31194357e745

- remove rhsm_repository module since it is included with Ansible 2.5
- improve test environment
- convert katello-rhsm-consumer script to Ansible tasks
- gather service and package facts
- use ansible_facts dictionary for facts rather than ansible_[fact]
- set rhsm_server_prefix, rhsm_repo_ca_cert, and rhsm_full_refresh_on_yum
  based on portal or satellite registration

Change-Id: Ifdbcc3b23d5f6ea68dcf904e40a7f44c4b61622e
'}]
commit_message:
Configure Satellite using Ansible instead of a script

- remove rhsm_repository module since it is included with Ansible 2.5
- improve test environment
- convert katello-rhsm-consumer script to Ansible tasks
- gather service and package facts
- use ansible_facts dictionary for facts rather than ansible_[fact]
- set rhsm_server_prefix, rhsm_repo_ca_cert, and rhsm_full_refresh_on_yum
  based on portal or satellite registration

Change-Id: Ifdbcc3b23d5f6ea68dcf904e40a7f44c4b61622e

commit_message:
Fixup the docs building

This commit enable users to run `tox -e docs` to build docs for os-ken.
It fixes several issues to ensure the build will succeed.
In addition, the docs from upstream Ryu library is grouped into
archived content. The future work is merging those docs into
the os-ken contents.

Change-Id: I5ee1998e0d2835495650cda530eb0b73c49b091a

commit_message:
Fixes related to installation on Trusty

As the role based macro links are pointing to unreachable destination
and are not required, they will be removed.
Additionally the timesouts are increased for API commands to ES, along
with minor changes around the upstart system manager

Change-Id: I2572bce230af2fd43261c9b0bf903bfd9655959e

commit_message:
Allow creating port by specific subnet_id only

Subnet id is enough for user to create port, neutron
can simple query the db to get the ralated network
id.

Depends-On: I9875ff11087a763b797e601a457c4d7e42c5508a

Closes-Bug: #1797140
Change-Id: I7f6c695c0c23747d953b1de40c46f782c55b4fa1

commit_message:
Allow create port by subnet_id only

Add a port param to port extension attribute list, then
we can post (create) subnet_id during the port creation.

Change-Id: I9875ff11087a763b797e601a457c4d7e42c5508a
Closes-Bug: #1797140

subject: Schedule VM's on default host aggregate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-18 09:52:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/approved/schedule_vms_on_default_host_aggregate.rst'], 'message': "Schedule VM's on default host aggregate

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter.

An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' which has
specific metadata defined. When a VM is booted from an image
which doesn't have special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then
it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate' group.
The new `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter
will help to achieve this.

Change-Id: I87cc7e94043b2e0afa10450861fcec053d40ab93
Implements: bp use-default-host-aggregate-for-vms-booted-using-image-with-no-special-property
"}]
commit_message:
Schedule VM's on default host aggregate

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter.

An operator can define a 'default host aggregate' which has
specific metadata defined. When a VM is booted from an image
which doesn't have special property(e.g. img.os:windows) then
it shall schedule on 'default host aggregate' group.
The new `AggregateDefaultHostGroupFilter` scheduler filter
will help to achieve this.

Change-Id: I87cc7e94043b2e0afa10450861fcec053d40ab93
Implements: bp use-default-host-aggregate-for-vms-booted-using-image-with-no-special-property

commit_message:
Bi-directional enforcement of traits

Add `SPECIAL_*` traits to resource providers and if these
special traits are not requested in flavor or images, then
those particular resource providers will not be returned
in the ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API call.

Change-Id: Ib3d170778b5bbd19738920514d434e8dc976a337

subject: remove basic distro packages from the repo server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-18 01:50:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/horizon_install_source.yml'], 'message': 'remove basic distro packages from the repo server

The build process was installing the general distro packages on the
build target. While this works it installed extra packages on
environments resulting in unforseen issues. In this case the horizon
distro packages installed apache into the repo server which can, and
does, create a conflict with nginx.

Change-Id: I1fb6fa641085367ae3192ade2f289b6247c6c377
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
remove basic distro packages from the repo server

The build process was installing the general distro packages on the
build target. While this works it installed extra packages on
environments resulting in unforseen issues. In this case the horizon
distro packages installed apache into the repo server which can, and
does, create a conflict with nginx.

Change-Id: I1fb6fa641085367ae3192ade2f289b6247c6c377
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-09 20:26:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/ibm/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'message': 'Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922
(cherry picked from commit c42aba603b394789da1a09822510ee3b428c1069)
(cherry picked from commit 542662d3a8e4e46af4d762732dd79d90f11c57dc)
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: self assign the SCSI lun id for volume attaching

Currently, the SCSI lun id is assigned by storage. But Storwize may
assigned the same SCSI lun id for different volumes on different i/o
groups. The wrong volume may be discovered with the same wwpn and same
lun id.

This patch reverts the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/360394/,
Storwize volume driver calculates an unused SCSI lun id and sends the
SCSI lun id to storage.
To avoid the problem of patch 360394,  this patch retries 3 times to
map volume to host if there is CMMVC5879E error.

Change-Id: I3d3c61f913ff7ec8d35c8105cecc1a51accd21e7
Closes-Bug: 1757922
(cherry picked from commit c42aba603b394789da1a09822510ee3b428c1069)
(cherry picked from commit 542662d3a8e4e46af4d762732dd79d90f11c57dc)

commit_message:
Handling type's multiattach extra specs in API task flow

This patch fixs two issues related to multiattach extra specs:

1. Volume's multiattach attribute will always be False if it's
   created by a multiattach type while type is specified in source
   volume, snapshot, image metadata or config file, related patch [1].
2. 'MULTIATTACH_POLICY' will not be validated if multiattach flag is
   specified in the volume type that from source volume, snapshot,
   image metadata or config file [2].

[1]: a32e24ff3e2c3083b42dd3654355f8c101363147
[2]: ff30971d1f7b1f4febdef9358a999017bea2296d
Closes-Bug: #1770671

Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py
    cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py

Most conflicts caused by the az-in-volumetype work done in
I4e6aa7af707bd063e7edf2b0bf28e3071ad5c67a and
Ibe937d5a97d685f5d9c3f8c03c5c384bb02a6942.

Change-Id: Ibec0656d9ead726ca12e62091fda74c04ec99eda
(cherry picked from commit 23f26555b3d4d1a089d09cd2335c39a73997c55e)

commit_message:
Strict isolation of group of hosts for images

The aim of this blueprint is to add a new
`AggregateImagePropertiesStrictIsolation` scheduler filter.

An operator wants to schedule instances having a specific
image property on a pre-defined group of hosts. In addition,
the operator would also like to prevent instances without
the special image property from being placed on this group
of hosts.

Implements: bp strict-isolation-of-group-of-hosts-for-image-and-flavor
Change-Id: If1f4a5eec06305daf3044ebac8a2e67dd45d0b85

commit_message:
API Option for Signature Verification

This spec describes a change which would allow end users to request
that Nova perform image signature verification when booting a new
instance, instead of relying solely on the existing configuration
option.

Change-Id: I764b2a07a974119762c782203960c8d8f250dbef
Blueprint: nova-api-option-signatures

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-29 23:49:29.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6821c9ce57f31bea43d165910008cc86e310173b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6821c9ce57f31bea43d165910008cc86e310173b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
The validation of iscsi session should be case insensitive

The validation of iscsi session should be case insensitive since IPv6
address is case insensitive. If the portal address are all lower cases,
and the address get from 'iscsiadm -m session' contain upper cases,
the validation of iscsi session will failed, the loop will be endless.

Change-Id: Ief5108e40f13cc53d8d9e9c5d1a5054f58f72aa0
Closes-bug: #1793627
(cherry picked from commit 8782c4accfea8a745676517c1880810cfa07feac)
(cherry picked from commit e01e5db822b29f898763197ec98e2c31f0b05c53)

subject: [Queens/Pike] Re-registry with new rhel_reg parameters on upgrade.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 29222, 'name': 'Natal Ngétal', 'email': 'hobbestigrou@erakis.eu', 'username': 'hobbestigrou'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-19 12:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['environments/major-upgrade-converge-docker.yaml', 'extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration/scripts/rhel-registration', 'environments/major-upgrade-composable-steps-docker.yaml'], 'message': '[Queens/Pike] Re-registry with new rhel_reg parameters on upgrade.

Currently, when the overcloud nodes were registered in Satellite
or portal during deployment via extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration
and an upgrade is performed passing different values for rhel_reg_repos
these changes are not taken into account. As a consequence, we end up
running the upgrade steps with the previous repositories configured
during deployment.

This patch allows us to re-register using the --force option using
the new values inserted at the pre-upgrade step. To allow this, we
make use of the RHELRegistrationAction parameter to change the
action in which the RHELRegistrationDeployment resource is run.
By setting it to UPDATE, the SoftwareDeployment resource will
be triggered during the stack update which takes place in the
upgrade. Passing the force option will force the re-execution
of rhel-registration script even though it was executed previously
during deployment (bypassing the /mnt/state/var/lib/rhsm/rhsm.ok
guard.

Change-Id: I51a1dad5f422756d0a8c4deff81c170be7d944d3
Related-Bug: #1797138
(cherry picked from commit 18987fbe32316e3ed8c7afcc3bf6199a10d0ee8b)
'}]
commit_message:
[Queens/Pike] Re-registry with new rhel_reg parameters on upgrade.

Currently, when the overcloud nodes were registered in Satellite
or portal during deployment via extraconfig/pre_deploy/rhel-registration
and an upgrade is performed passing different values for rhel_reg_repos
these changes are not taken into account. As a consequence, we end up
running the upgrade steps with the previous repositories configured
during deployment.

This patch allows us to re-register using the --force option using
the new values inserted at the pre-upgrade step. To allow this, we
make use of the RHELRegistrationAction parameter to change the
action in which the RHELRegistrationDeployment resource is run.
By setting it to UPDATE, the SoftwareDeployment resource will
be triggered during the stack update which takes place in the
upgrade. Passing the force option will force the re-execution
of rhel-registration script even though it was executed previously
during deployment (bypassing the /mnt/state/var/lib/rhsm/rhsm.ok
guard.

Change-Id: I51a1dad5f422756d0a8c4deff81c170be7d944d3
Related-Bug: #1797138
(cherry picked from commit 18987fbe32316e3ed8c7afcc3bf6199a10d0ee8b)

commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore file

When you create the placement document locally with `tox -e docs`,
some of the files are created under the `doc/source/_static` directory
and are tracked by git because the .gitignore file is not set
appropriately. This patch fixes it cleaning up old nova configurations
in the .gitignore file.

Change-Id: I1ecae90c9ba1cccdcd4befec3513ba2fdacb4cea

subject: Only b64encode ssl_ca if it needs it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-16 18:36:49.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ssl_utils.py', 'unit_tests/test_ssl_utils.py'], 'message': 'Only b64encode ssl_ca if it needs it

The description of the ssl_ca config option in config.yaml states
that the certificate should be base64 encoded. But if it is then
the charm b64encodes it again when sending the ca down the client
relations. This change gates encoding the ca on whether it is
already encoded.

Change-Id: I9828d7567fd7f04cd0d80229ea1ff1275ea4269e
Closes-Bug: #1798066
'}]
commit_message:
Only b64encode ssl_ca if it needs it

The description of the ssl_ca config option in config.yaml states
that the certificate should be base64 encoded. But if it is then
the charm b64encodes it again when sending the ca down the client
relations. This change gates encoding the ca on whether it is
already encoded.

Change-Id: I9828d7567fd7f04cd0d80229ea1ff1275ea4269e
Closes-Bug: #1798066

commit_message:
Remove WindowsDriver mapping

The WindowsDriver was renamed to WindowsISCSIDriver in change
I3877491463dce3d46f7ac0e194ffdf46a0e7c84c to avoid confusion with the
Windows SMB driver. It has now been two release cycles and the backward
compatibility mapping can now be removed.

Change-Id: I602cccac73b6dc8d0b0824a5dffb0373c151452e
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[Ocata/Pike/Queens] Make rhel-registration scripts location absolute.

This patch modifies the script files location to be executed
during the SoftwareDeployment resources in rhel-registration.yaml.
The main purpose of this is to ensure we are running the right
script content related to a branch, for example, after an upgrade.

Change-Id: If77acb78c63511054e17d553982e19e748c88992
Related-Bug: #1797138
(cherry picked from commit 91746c290be5fc374ad2389694779a7b57351c81)

commit_message:
Correct python3 detection logic

Use python3 only on platforms where this is the default and avoids the
problem where python3 is used when it was installed by the user.

python3 will be used for CentOS>=8,RHEL>=8,Fedora>=28

Change-Id: If65d2c3d42818942a9b05ba654dfdd998bcced61

So far Swift on the undercloud used /srv/node/1, while Swift deployed by
TripleO uses /srv/node/d1 as default. When moving to a containerized
undercloud, this needs to be adopted as well.

This requires updating the ring files as well as moving the directory.

Change-Id: I66e1600a121869d17cfdba86910944e718c774f6
'}]
commit_message:
Change Swift storage directory to /srv/node/d1

So far Swift on the undercloud used /srv/node/1, while Swift deployed by
TripleO uses /srv/node/d1 as default. When moving to a containerized
undercloud, this needs to be adopted as well.

This requires updating the ring files as well as moving the directory.

Change-Id: I66e1600a121869d17cfdba86910944e718c774f6

subject: do not flush selection on "old" boot source
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-31 09:21:47.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/source/source.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/source/source.controller.js'], 'message': 'do not flush selection on "old" boot source

This fixes an issue introduced by watchers:
when page initialized images watchers called before
select boot source watcher.it leads to sutiation when
we specify selection from user input and flush it on
updateBootSource. as a result page come to
inconsistent state described in the bug.
Perhaps, this requires big refactoring but  in the
current patch we do not flush selection if boot type
was not changed. it allows to use image, snapshot,
volume from context as ctrl.selection.

Change-Id: I4b23071a2a9e2c02cc1f46713165e5cb5155894f
Closes-Bug: #1710890
(cherry picked from commit 48862eb9b7f5789dee3362d9103416628c5d3e76)
'}]
commit_message:
do not flush selection on "old" boot source

This fixes an issue introduced by watchers:
when page initialized images watchers called before
select boot source watcher.it leads to sutiation when
we specify selection from user input and flush it on
updateBootSource. as a result page come to
inconsistent state described in the bug.
Perhaps, this requires big refactoring but  in the
current patch we do not flush selection if boot type
was not changed. it allows to use image, snapshot,
volume from context as ctrl.selection.

Change-Id: I4b23071a2a9e2c02cc1f46713165e5cb5155894f
Closes-Bug: #1710890
(cherry picked from commit 48862eb9b7f5789dee3362d9103416628c5d3e76)

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-10-18 20:10:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Ensure attachment cleanup on failure in driver.pre_live_migration

Previously, if the call to driver.pre_live_migration failed (which in
libvirt can happen with a DestinationDiskExists exception), the
compute manager wouldn't rollback/cleanup volume attachments, leading
to corrupt volume attachment information, and, depending on the
backend, the instance being unable to access its volume. This patch
moves the driver.pre_live_migration call inside the existing
try/except, allowing the compute manager to properly rollback/cleanup
volume attachments.

The compute manager has its own _rollback_live_migration() cleanup in
case the pre_live_migration() RPC call to the destination fails. There
should be no conflicts between the cleanup in that and the new volume
cleanup in the except block. The remove_volume_connection() ->
driver_detach() -> detach_volume() call catches the InstanceNotFound
exception and warns about the instance disappearing (it was never
really on the destination in the first place). The attachment_delete()
in _rollback_live_migration() is contingent on there being an
old_vol_attachment in migrate_data, which there isn't because
pre_live_migration() raised instead of returning.

Change-Id: I67f66e95d69ae6df22e539550a3eac697ea8f5d8
Closes-bug: 1778206
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure attachment cleanup on failure in driver.pre_live_migration

Previously, if the call to driver.pre_live_migration failed (which in
libvirt can happen with a DestinationDiskExists exception), the
compute manager wouldn't rollback/cleanup volume attachments, leading
to corrupt volume attachment information, and, depending on the
backend, the instance being unable to access its volume. This patch
moves the driver.pre_live_migration call inside the existing
try/except, allowing the compute manager to properly rollback/cleanup
volume attachments.

The compute manager has its own _rollback_live_migration() cleanup in
case the pre_live_migration() RPC call to the destination fails. There
should be no conflicts between the cleanup in that and the new volume
cleanup in the except block. The remove_volume_connection() ->
driver_detach() -> detach_volume() call catches the InstanceNotFound
exception and warns about the instance disappearing (it was never
really on the destination in the first place). The attachment_delete()
in _rollback_live_migration() is contingent on there being an
old_vol_attachment in migrate_data, which there isn't because
pre_live_migration() raised instead of returning.

Change-Id: I67f66e95d69ae6df22e539550a3eac697ea8f5d8
Closes-bug: 1778206

subject: Unify the time format about get_time_frame
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 08:29:48.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/tests/storage/test_storage.py', 'cloudkitty/api/v1/controllers/storage.py', 'cloudkitty/storage/sqlalchemy/__init__.py', 'cloudkitty/tests/samples.py'], 'message': 'Unify the time format about get_time_frame

The parameters of time(begin and end) should unify format at
the /v1/storage/dataframes invoking workflow.

1. In API controllers, change the time format from datetime.datetime
   to timestamp.
   begin_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(begin); end_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(end)

2. In storage module, change the time format from timestamp to
   datetime.datetime again.
   ck_utils.ts2dt(begin); ck_utils.ts2dt(end)

So the time format should always be datetime.datetime, the two phases
format changes are redundance and unnecessary.

Change-Id: Ie570ddab079196164e45a8b0182bc2e878778827
'}]
commit_message:
Unify the time format about get_time_frame

The parameters of time(begin and end) should unify format at
the /v1/storage/dataframes invoking workflow.

1. In API controllers, change the time format from datetime.datetime
   to timestamp.
   begin_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(begin); end_ts = ck_utils.dt2ts(end)

2. In storage module, change the time format from timestamp to
   datetime.datetime again.
   ck_utils.ts2dt(begin); ck_utils.ts2dt(end)

So the time format should always be datetime.datetime, the two phases
format changes are redundance and unnecessary.

Change-Id: Ie570ddab079196164e45a8b0182bc2e878778827

subject: Robust the mapping comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-14 02:41:22.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/tests/test_hashmap.py', 'cloudkitty/rating/hash/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Robust the mapping comparison

In two situations below, we can't get the result as expected:

1. creat a mapping, the value in mapping and meter data in ceilometer
has different decimal place.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 1.0 -c 1 -g *

    and even if the size of volume is 1 in ceilometer, the price
    of this volume will always be 0 because of '1'!='1.0'.

2. when call quote from python-cloudkittyclient with number instead
of string in desc dict.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 50 -c 1 -g *

    then we call quote as quote(resources=
    [{"desc": {"size": 50}, "volume": 50, "service": "volume"}]}),
    then we'll get the 0 because of 50!='50'.

Change-Id: I60033b71c61806a2978096be073b919a10f0f29b
'}]
commit_message:
Robust the mapping comparison

In two situations below, we can't get the result as expected:

1. creat a mapping, the value in mapping and meter data in ceilometer
has different decimal place.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 1.0 -c 1 -g *

    and even if the size of volume is 1 in ceilometer, the price
    of this volume will always be 0 because of '1'!='1.0'.

2. when call quote from python-cloudkittyclient with number instead
of string in desc dict.

    cloudkitty hashmap-group-create -n volume_g
    cloudkitty hashmap-service-create -n volume
    cloudkitty hashmap-mapping-create -f * -t flat -v 50 -c 1 -g *

    then we call quote as quote(resources=
    [{"desc": {"size": 50}, "volume": 50, "service": "volume"}]}),
    then we'll get the 0 because of 50!='50'.

Change-Id: I60033b71c61806a2978096be073b919a10f0f29b

subject: Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 15197, 'name': 'Pierre Riteau', 'email': 'pierre@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'priteau', 'status': 'StackHPC'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24828, 'name': 'Kaifeng Wang', 'email': 'kaifeng.w@gmail.com', 'username': 'wangkf'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 11:12:03.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/hardware.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-bmc-ip-detection-for-coreos-483be0286593e393.yaml'], 'message': "Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
Story: #2004121
Task: #27571
(cherry picked from commit 8eecadb0a8a36eb541b96d6d2fcce12dbb121181)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix BMC IP address detection on CoreOS images

On CoreOS images, IPA runs in a Debian Jessie chroot which uses mawk as
its default awk implementation. However, mawk doesn't support POSIX
character classes such as [:space:], which means get_bmc_address() fails
to parse the BMC IP address from the output of ipmitool.

This patch replaces the use of [[:space:]] by [ \t] which is equivalent
for the purpose of parsing the output of ipmitool. Note that matching on
tab characters is not strictly required as the packaged version of
ipmitool only uses space characters, but is left in case tabs are used
in other versions.

Change-Id: I0e3306a4d4584ca28e03608e9f7270b770960a39
Story: #2004121
Task: #27571
(cherry picked from commit 8eecadb0a8a36eb541b96d6d2fcce12dbb121181)

subject: Ensure that the flavor/network facts are available to all targets
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-10-18 11:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/octavia_mgmt_network.yml', 'tasks/octavia_post_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tasks/octavia_flavor_create.yml'], 'message': "Ensure that the flavor/network facts are available to all targets

Currently the registered result for the flavor creation is
only available on localhost. To ensure that it is available
on all hosts we first create it using the designated service
host, then fetch the details and set a fact for all hosts.

We do the same for the management network fact.

In order to achieve this, shade needs to be present on the
target host, so we add it into the octavia venv. We also make
sure that the octavia service account is used, because that's
where the flavor and network objects were created and only that
account has access to them.

Change-Id: I85b533dbb5fa29382dc615b584b21ff1a5d67a46
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that the flavor/network facts are available to all targets

Currently the registered result for the flavor creation is
only available on localhost. To ensure that it is available
on all hosts we first create it using the designated service
host, then fetch the details and set a fact for all hosts.

We do the same for the management network fact.

In order to achieve this, shade needs to be present on the
target host, so we add it into the octavia venv. We also make
sure that the octavia service account is used, because that's
where the flavor and network objects were created and only that
account has access to them.

Change-Id: I85b533dbb5fa29382dc615b584b21ff1a5d67a46

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-22 09:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['roles/convert-image/templates/convert_image.sh.j2', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/templates/update_image.sh.j2', 'roles/repo-setup/templates/repo_setup.sh.j2', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/templates/inject_gating_repo.sh.j2', 'roles/repo-setup/defaults/main.yml', 'quickstart.sh'], 'message': 'Revert "Use dnf and python3 on platforms where these are default"

ansible 2.5.7[1] is not compatible with python 3.4 which is in CentOS7.

Collecting ansible==2.5.7 (from -r requirements.txt (line 3))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/af/1e/edce5e4eb8d47716e3246185d08d626301efa433c4743ae47f9e3a5b9fef/ansible-2.5.7.tar.gz
ansible requires Python '>=2.6,!=3.0.*,!=3.1.*,!=3.2.*,!=3.3.*,!=3.4.*' but the running Python is 3.4.9

We should revert this on bump ansible version.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/requirements.txt#L3

This reverts commit f2f6dcb209df33d063382f89a4a5c7620a3c91ac.

Change-Id: Ia920d3b10a91463dc522b959ae77864112dcd099
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Use dnf and python3 on platforms where these are default"

ansible 2.5.7[1] is not compatible with python 3.4 which is in CentOS7.

Collecting ansible==2.5.7 (from -r requirements.txt (line 3))
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/af/1e/edce5e4eb8d47716e3246185d08d626301efa433c4743ae47f9e3a5b9fef/ansible-2.5.7.tar.gz
ansible requires Python '>=2.6,!=3.0.*,!=3.1.*,!=3.2.*,!=3.3.*,!=3.4.*' but the running Python is 3.4.9

We should revert this on bump ansible version.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/requirements.txt#L3

This reverts commit f2f6dcb209df33d063382f89a4a5c7620a3c91ac.

Change-Id: Ia920d3b10a91463dc522b959ae77864112dcd099

commit_message:
Document security considerations for detailed healthcheck

The detailed healthcheck output includes some potentially sensitive
information like stack traces of the service. This may be
unacceptable in some organizations and we should point it out in the
help for the option.

Change-Id: Ic10c29f39ef601e4c7873acb0d56e1ec8e4ebcb3

commit_message:
Added only_now parameter to action report-tenant-list

The API of getting rated tenant list is enhanced, if the new parameter
only_now is true, this API will return the immediate rated tenant list.
This patch modified the action report-tenant-list so that CLI also
support passing only_now parameter.

Change-Id: I97cd379c793e7d7f92b077aa2a799524c6c09e10
Depends-On: Ia963d22fdd2722b7dd5528cb5b782954f892e7ee

commit_message:
Fix unit tests after charms.openstack update

A recent commit to charms.openstack (78ce162e) added support for
using endpoints rather than relations. This caused an aodh unit
test to fail as it was looking for an endpoint. This change is a
simple fix for that.

Change-Id: I6b41352ccf0e422cd5e80a7a47f640164df3e14b

For openstack client, the begin and end args format is timestamp

format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS). So this patch make it easy what change

commit_message:
[OpenStack client] Change the time args format when total-get

For openstack client, the begin and end args format is timestamp
in total-get command, which is less convenient than date/time
format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS). So this patch make it easy what change
the time args format from timestamp to date/time.

Change-Id: I5ce9a40dd60a3e7b3a91042a20df10e4ab9499ba

The begin and end args format is timestamp in summary-get command,
which is less convenient than date/time format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS).
So this patch make it easy to use.

Refer to the patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402089/

Change-Id: I03c111d4d38082d748f5974189237c8f638688ab

commit_message:
Change the time format from timestamp to date/time when summary-get

The begin and end args format is timestamp in summary-get command,
which is less convenient than date/time format(YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS).
So this patch make it easy to use.

Refer to the patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402089/

Change-Id: I03c111d4d38082d748f5974189237c8f638688ab

subject: Support listening to multiple rabbit queues.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-10-19 07:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_ceilometer_contexts.py', 'lib/ceilometer_utils.py', 'hooks/ceilometer_hooks.py', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'templates/ocata/ceilometer.conf', 'hooks/amqp-listener-relation-changed', 'hooks/amqp-listener-relation-joined', 'metadata.yaml', 'lib/ceilometer_contexts.py', 'README.md', 'hooks/amqp-listener-relation-departed'], 'message': "Support listening to multiple rabbit queues.

This change adds the ability to listen for events across multiple
rabbit queues. Nova cells v2 has a message broker per cell and
the charms already support having a separate message broker for
neutron, in both these topologies ceilometer needs the ability to
listen to multiple brokers.

To achieve this a new relation 'amqp-listener' has been introduced.
The existing 'amqp' relation should be used for the broker that
ceilometer listens to and publishes to. 'amqp-listener' should be
used for additional brokers that ceilometer just listens on.

Update functional tests to satisfy relation with
nova-cloud-controller.

Change-Id: Ifdade3f7814620f4cd4a1d35a584cbc099bb6d88
"}]
commit_message:
Support listening to multiple rabbit queues.

This change adds the ability to listen for events across multiple
rabbit queues. Nova cells v2 has a message broker per cell and
the charms already support having a separate message broker for
neutron, in both these topologies ceilometer needs the ability to
listen to multiple brokers.

To achieve this a new relation 'amqp-listener' has been introduced.
The existing 'amqp' relation should be used for the broker that
ceilometer listens to and publishes to. 'amqp-listener' should be
used for additional brokers that ceilometer just listens on.

Update functional tests to satisfy relation with
nova-cloud-controller.

Change-Id: Ifdade3f7814620f4cd4a1d35a584cbc099bb6d88

commit_message:
Workflow uses parameter "viewModel.ready" to do the repetitive work.

In workflow module, every item in navigation used
'ng-show="viewModel.ready"' to determine whether it should
be display, it makes no sense to do so, and should replace
with the item parameter "step.ready" to control itself show
or hide.

Change-Id: Iadc5c90995022b2e0a13bcd46e4f2de64d1088b5
Closes-bug: #1797309

commit_message:
Do not raise invalid message when port does not exist

The exception handling for port, floating IP's or networks
is too broad. Add specific error handling and in a case when
the resource is not found do not raise a invalid message.

Change-Id: I98ee2ff816c03980645752eebb4e39d3ecd2e158
Closes-bug: #1796565

subject: Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-15 03:55:56.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore'], 'message': 'Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I2c70b7b8c2e9d80bf9ddc90aec9a01ddc5745128
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up .gitignore references to personal tools

Developers run all sorts of different tools within Git repositories,
any of which can leave their own special trashfiles all over the
place. We can't every hope to catalog them all, so better to
recommend developers simply configure a global core.excludesfile to
filter the irrelevant files which tend to get created by their
personal choice of tools.

To this end, remove the long-standing sections for "Mr Developer"
and "Editors" since their mere existence here sends the signal that
we welcome (and have time to review) additions for any old tool
someone ever might happen to try. Also add a comment block
explaining this, for clarity.

We can, and should of course, continue to list files created by the
tools recommended by our workflow (test frameworks called from tox,
documentation and packaging builds, et cetera).

This change is a port of I1b41efac219fca44e2548fc36633724d0ecfc0cb
from the openstack-dev/oslo-cookiecutter repository.

Change-Id: I2c70b7b8c2e9d80bf9ddc90aec9a01ddc5745128

commit_message:
python3: Ensure ConfigOpts __iter__ uses list(d.keys())

d.keys() no longer returns a copy of the keys in Python 3.
This is part of PEP 3106.

Change-Id: Ie4897109c87d6dc2952c2eb35b83fe368fb31803
Closes-Bug: #1796163

commit_message:
Allow Ipv6 addresses for nova_metadata_host

Current logic didn't check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address
causing the proxy request to fail with an exception because the url is
not valid.

This patchs check if the nova_metadata_host is an IPv6 address and
create a valid url enclosing the IPv6 address with brackets

Closes-Bug: #1796593

Change-Id: Ibfebffcec2c8860237a1f151084de978a7863bd8
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
(cherry picked from commit 85588ad38e3a08137f4f7b4be98ce271064eb2f0)

commit_message:
heat-base: remove default policy rules

... the rule:context_is_admin is now managed in policy-in-code, in Heat:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/heat/tree/heat/policies/base.py#n25

Furthermore, the policy.json file management was removed with:
https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/11102/

Change-Id: Ibb2b7fa8750070fb338d04482a473a2bb3a2ea80
(cherry picked from commit c54b1b6169a8c4270068d14f7f9d270f2b563051)

commit_message:
The theme is openstackdocs

Fix path lookup, see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/607298/12/openstackdocstheme/paths.py
and  openstackdocstheme/ext.py where we check for "openstackdocs" and
not "openstack".

Change-Id: I669b0368f27916b027205828cf3982657c64326d

subject: Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-10-05 12:43:03.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_resource_chain.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/resource_chain.py', 'heat/objects/service.py'], 'message': 'Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1
'}]
commit_message:
Set a concurrency limit on ResourceChain

This adds a limit to the number of resources that ResourceChain creates
in parallel. It reduces memory usage drastically when ResourceChain
contains lots of resources. We use the number of active services, which
seems to give a reasonable balance between performance and memory
consumption.

Story: #2003975
Task: #26917
Change-Id: Id20fb89813b32927298b3a7c0abe23da710b04d1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-10-15 17:41:16.000000000', 'files': ['roles/validate-tempest/vars/tempest_skip_master.yml', 'roles/validate-tempest/vars/tempest_skip_rocky.yml'], 'message': "Un-skip manila and sahara tests on master and Rocky

Iaf70abbb9ca6a18f081ca715b9f7f165a0c0600c introduced
a change to skip tests belonging to various tempest plugins.
Manila's tempest tests are configured and enabled on
master and stable/rocky in Featuresets 008 [1] and 019 [2].
Sahara's tempest tests are configured and enabled on
master and stable/rocky in Featuresets 007 [3] and 018 [4].

Remove these two tempest plugins from the skip list. They
are very much supported in TripleO and they are adequately
configured with the tempest_config options in the featuresets
referenced.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset008.yml
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset019.yml

[4] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset018.yml

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609741/
Change-Id: I4656f3d70ec523160b489f8131e6cc3971bd85b8
"}]
commit_message:
Un-skip manila and sahara tests on master and Rocky

Iaf70abbb9ca6a18f081ca715b9f7f165a0c0600c introduced
a change to skip tests belonging to various tempest plugins.
Manila's tempest tests are configured and enabled on
master and stable/rocky in Featuresets 008 [1] and 019 [2].
Sahara's tempest tests are configured and enabled on
master and stable/rocky in Featuresets 007 [3] and 018 [4].

Remove these two tempest plugins from the skip list. They
are very much supported in TripleO and they are adequately
configured with the tempest_config options in the featuresets
referenced.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset008.yml
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset019.yml
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset007.yml
[4] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/tree/config/general_config/featureset018.yml

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609741/
Change-Id: I4656f3d70ec523160b489f8131e6cc3971bd85b8

commit_message:
Improve services management in client

This patch add/update cmd as follows:
    cloudkitty info-service-list
       list add services
    cloudkitty info-service-get -n compute
       show compute service detail info
    cloudkitty info-service-enable -n compute
       enable compute service
    cloudkitty info-service-disable -n compute
       disable compute service

Depends-On: a208bcab09ba0fe7567d9d89c8cb009218187cf0
Implements: blueprint enable-disable-service

Change-Id: If169242d891472b81edc8fbb91e9abeb9004e398

commit_message:
Add puppet-neutron-tripleo-standalone job

* It overrrides the tripleo-standalone featureset override to run Neutron
  specific tempest tests.

* It will help to detect the puppet-neutron tempest specific issues
  early in gates.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609666

Change-Id: Idf58967c3e394f71e886346f224087254be0c118

Isolate repo wheel builds from pip.conf

The repo wheel builds need to be isolated from pip.conf
to ensure that new wheels can be built whenever doing an
upgrade.
